page.title: 20TRANSPORT
page.content: Brompton is bounded by 2 good 'A' category roads.On its west side is the A167 giving access to Darlington and linking with the main A1 trunk road to London and Scotland.To the east the A684 provides a link with the A19 trunk road.The village is served by a regular bus service to Darlington in one direction and Northallerton in the other.There are 7 buses on a weekday and 4 on Sundays.Additionally on market days,Wednesday and Saturday, a coach company based in the village runs a half_hourly service to and from Northallerton,1.5 miles away.A railway goods line passes along the west side of the village going north to Teesside.An average of 20 trains per day necessitate the closing of the level crossing in the village.
